dji.sdk.api.GroundStation

Class DJIHotPointInitializationInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • dji.sdk.api.GroundStation.DJIHotPointInitializationInfo

  • public class DJIHotPointInitializationInfo
extends java.lang.Object

    DJI Hot Point Initialization Information Class

    This class is used as an input parameter for the function startHotPoint in DJIGroundStation, which initializes a hot point mission. A hot point mission specifies a coordinate location, called a hot point, which the aircraft orbits with a constant radius.
    The information in this data structure customizes the nature of hot point mission, such as the location of the hot point and the exact way the drone chooses to orbit it.
    Version:
    V2.4.0
    Author:
    DJI Software
    See Also:
    DJIGroundStation

    • Field Detail

      • latitude

        public double latitude
        Used to set the hot point's latitude, in degrees.

      • longitude

        public double longitude
        Used to set the hot point's longitude, in degrees.

      • altitude

        public double altitude
        Used to set the hot point's altitude, in meters. The altitude is measured relative to ground level, which is the altitude of the drone as it begins taking off.
        Range is [5m, 120m].

      • radius

        public double radius
        Used to sets the radius, in meters, of the circle drawn by the aircraft as it orbits the hot point.
        Range is [5m, 500m] .

      • velocity

        public int velocity
        Used to set the angular velocity of the aircraft, in degrees/second, as it orbits the hot point. The angular velocity is relative to the surroundRadius. You can use the maxAngularVelocityForRadius method to get the maximum supported angular velocity, based on the current radius value.
        Range is [0m/s, 30m/s]. Default value is 20.

      • surroundDirection

        public DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationHotPointSurroundDirection surroundDirection
        Used to set whether the aircraft orbits the hot point in a clockwise or anti-clockwise direction.
        Default is clockwise.

      • interestDirection

        public DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationHotPointInterestDirection interestDirection
        Used to set the point in the circular path around the hot point where the aircraft will begin its orbit. After taking off, the aircraft will fly directly to that point, then begin rotating around the hot point.
        Possible values for this enum include the northernmost, southernmost, westernmost and easternmost points on the circular path. interestDirection can also be set to Nearest, which commands the drone to fly to the closest point on the circular path, before beginning to orbit the hot point.

      • navigationMode

        public DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationHotPointNavigationMode navigationMode
        Used to set how the aircraft chooses where to point itself while orbiting the hot point. In other words, how the yaw or heading value is decided. The aircraft can be pointed towards or away from the hot point, forwards or backwards along its flight route, or be controlled by the remote controller.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DJIHotPointInitializationInfo

        public DJIHotPointInitializationInfo()
        DJIHotPointInitializationInfo constructor function.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStation

    • Method Detail

      • maxAngularVelocityForRadius

        public static double maxAngularVelocityForRadius(double surroundRadius)
        Returns the maximum supported angular velocity in degrees/second for the given surrounding radius.

        Post Condition:
        The calculated result should be used to give an upper limit for the velocity value.
        Parameters:
        surroundRadius - Surrounding radius for which to retrieve the maximum angular velocity. The input value should be in the range of [5, 500] meters or the value 0 will be returned.
        Returns:
        Returns the supported maximum angular velocity for the given surroundRadius.
